ratings.comment: George was my favorite of the three anthro100 professors. He actually engaged the class during lecture and would joke around. George was extremely helpful if you don't understand a topic, he even held a 2 hour review session before the exam. I would recommend reading Wisdom Sits in Places, you can see in the book what George teaches in lecture.
Great Professor, very easy and gives a lot of helpful examples. Review session was useful. You don't absolutely need to read Wisdom Sits in Places, chapter summaries were enough.

Material presented was boring and had no connection with itself. Capitalism, neo-liberalism, and random populations of natives in Sulawesi and New Guinea do not have much in common. Review session was great.

Had him for a fifteen person Anthro major course. He was a nice guy for sure, but class wasn't as engaging as I imagined it would be as I love cultural anthropology. My dislike for the class wasn't entirely his fault tho--some enrolled in the class weren't fond of showers.
Semi-Interesting lectures if you're into anthropology.  Exam is very fair and easy.  Reading the Reindeer people was a waste of time.

Professor George was alright. Reading The Reindeer People was a waste of my time, though. Also, he says "uh" and "um" approx. every third word. But if you can get past that, lectures are semi-interesting...
Good professor, some interesting lectures. The books assigned are alright, but really needed for discussion section more than lecture. Exams were mostly fair.

Ugh, horrible class.  The lectures are enough to coax you into a semi-comatose state 3 times a week and the readings are worthless.  The tests felt like a TA picked questions out of a hat and then slapped them on paper.  If you can avoid this, do so.

This class sucked! I was told that Anthro 104 was an easy A class but his test stupid. They were 50 multiple choise on material that was so subjective and he wouldn't review for the test and he wouldn't let the TAs review for the test. Going into the test you had no idea what it was going to be on.

worst prof/class i've taken in my two years at the UW. should have been an easy A but somehow wasn't? also, he didn't seem very educated to me...i was confused about how he had gotten this far in life basically.
he made a class of 1200 buy books written by: a) his best friend b) his wife

get ready to hear the words "upland Sulawesi" A LOT..his stories were interesting, but the class doesnt have a lot of structure.  lectures were kind of boring.  dont bother reading the 4 assigned books...i got an A with doing little reading

Ken George is funny and has a lot of good stories about upland Sulawesi. He gives a TON of details and examples when talking about different cultures, but it's hard to memorize all the examples he gives. (The TAs wrote the exams and chose ridiculously hard questions regarding stupid details). Overall an interesting class though.

There aren't many assignments for the class (2 papers, 4 books), but his lectures aren't the most interesting and he doesnt give any study guide what so ever or let his TA's hold review sessions. Test are on the hard side because you don't know what to study, but he did but a huge curve on the class overall.

It was an easy class as far as the workload. 4 readings and 2 easy papers. But I found it not as easy to obtain an A. The tests were hard, it was difficult to know what to study for. The reading were all pretty good books except for 1, French Beans and Food Scares - that was terrible. But overall, lots of interesting stuff!

Welcome to Anthropology, of course he'll talk about Sulawesi this is what he has spent his life studying! Overall, he is a really nice guy and he has a lot to say, he just crammed way too much in. Also, French Beans was the worst book in the world, but I really enjoyed The Walleye War. And his tests were difficult. A good prof if you enjoy anthro.

Professor George was by far the best professor that I at had at UW-Madison in my first semester.  His lectures were interesting and enlightening.  He taught a lot about third-world countries, and made his students think outside the box.  There is one midterm and one final. Don't read the books, just the Q & Q's.
Oh, I forgot. If you haven't heard about upland sulawesi, you will by the time you finish this class. I swear if I hear about that stupid country one more time....

His lectures are so abstract that they become meaningless. He really only conveys ideas, not suff that you can actually test on. You don't have to go to lecture, just get the notes. Tests are on vocab and basic comprehension, if you are alive you should get an A. He says um a lot, to the point of being annoying.
Disorganized lecture, nothing really connected. Talked about Sulawesi most of the time. Tests were difficult; had no idea what to study for them, really.
Lectures could be a bit boring at times but overall I thought it was a pretty decent class.  Exams are difficult, though.

I thought Professor George was a great. Very approachable. lectures were interesting. books were a bit boring though. would definitely recommend the class to someone who wants to get a general idea of anthropology
The class was horrible, but Ken is a cool guy. He has good stories, but overall the lectures were pretty boring. Wouldn't recommend the class, but I thought he was a good professor

Professor George is not very good. He stutters and says "um" a lot. If one attends his lectures, ignore what he says and just copy the notes. He shows too many movies which are incomprehensible. Exams are difficult, and the books he has us read are terrible (especially French Beans). If I pull off an A, it will have been with great difficulty.
nice person, but a hard class. tons of materials, not fun at all

This is the most pointless class I've ever taken in my life.  I think his goal is to make sure everyone fails the exam, because he refuses to tell you what is on it.  This is not an easy A...DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS. Plus the fact, he always makes up words in lecture, and it's really annoying.
nice guy and very nice to talk to

Incoherently babbles throughout his lectures a bunch of useless garbage that will never come up again in your life, ever.  He basically gives definitions that don't make sense about relatively simple concepts.  Probably wouldn't have a job if he didn't teach.  Complete waste of time...

His lectures are extremally boring.  He mostly talks about his trips.  Um's and ah's a lot...wish he'd just spit it out!  He is a nice guy outside of class though.  Hated my TA ...flighty, doesn't know what she's doing...
I think the exam is hard. The reading is too boring and the exam is tricky. Hw points are easy to get if you have a good TA
He made us read a book, "French Beans and Food Scares," and it is impossible.  Even the TA's hated it.  He then proceeded to put a lot of questions about it on the Midterm.
Seminar for Indonesian FIG, fall 2005. Pretty good, lots of interesting stories, very helpful. I got by doing very little of the assigned reading.
No Comments
No Comments
